div.span: Both surfaces heavily burnished to a waxy feel.
This is a small version of this type of lid.
May be edge of a handle.
Form is intermediate between 07b and 12; should be 7th or 8th century, depending on how the stance is reconstructed.
Presumably it is really a coarse Kaol-R and not the same as mid-medieval G1.
Could be C1a, though relatively sandy.
Band of dark grayish brown paint on exterior.
Some lime chunks up to 3 mm.
Three vertical stripes 4-8 mm wide of paint ~5YR4/2 dark reddish gray.
Brown glaze on exterior; smooth yellow-brown glaze (over white slip?) on interior.
Light yellow glaze (over white slip?) on interior; light yellow glaze on exterior.
Pale green glaze on interior and top of rim.
Yellowish brown glaze on exterior and around rim.
Yellowish brown glaze on exterior and around rim.
Strong green glaze on exterior and around rim.
Yellowish brown glaze on exterior and around rim.
Greenish yellow-brown glaze on part of exterior.
Light green glaze on part of interior and top of rim.
Greenish yellow glaze on interior and top of rim.
Light brownish green glaze on interior; exterior glaze-dusted with two splotches of pale greenish glaze.
Light greenish brown glaze all around.
Roulette-impressed decoration on exterior below rim.
Just the inner flange of a thick triangular rim.
Yellow-green glaze on top of rim; interior glaze-dusted.
Yellow-brown glaze on interior and around rim.
Yellow-brown glaze all around, thicker on exterior.
Yellow-green glaze on interior and around rim.
Light green glaze on both surfaces.
Pale green glaze on interior and top of rim; yellow-brown glaze on exterior.
Pale yellow glaze on interior and around rim; glaze-dusted exterior.
Yellow-brown glaze mottled with brown on interior.
Greenish yellow glaze on interior and top of rim.
Yellow glaze over white slip on interior; yellow glaze around rim.
Pale yellow glaze over white slip on interior; glaze-dusted exterior.
Smooth yellow glaze over white slip on interior; yellow glaze on exterior.
Pale yellow glaze over white slip on interior.
Sparse pale yellow glaze over white slip on interior; streaks of yellow glaze on exterior.
Yellow glaze over white slip on interior.
Light yellow glaze over white slip around rim.
Badly deteriorated glaze over white slip on interior.
Smooth brownish yellow glaze over white slip on interior; one line of thin brownish yellow glaze on exterior below rim.
Strong yellow glaze over white slip on interior and around rim.
Strong green glaze over white slip on exterior; cream glaze over white slip on interior of spout; light yellow glaze on interior of body.
Pale yellow glaze over white slip on interior; cream glaze over white slip on part of exterior.
Light yellow glaze with a spot of green over white slip on interior; yellow-brown glaze on exterior.
Pale yellow glaze over white slip on interior.
Overfired yellow glaze over white slip on interior.
Yellow glaze over white slip on interior.
Strong yellow glaze mottled with yellow-brown over white slip on interior.
Strong yellow glaze over white slip on interior.
Strong green glaze over white slip on interior.
Light brownish yellow glaze on interior.
Yellow glaze over white slip on interior and around rim.
Blue printed decoration on white glaze.
Light cobalt blue horizontal band below rim on interior.
Deteriorated white tin glaze on interior and around rim.
Faded black manganese decoration on interior.
Part of a horn or tubular spout.
Yellow glaze over white slip on interior.
Light yellow glaze over white slip on interior and around rim.
Cream glaze over white slip on interior.
Greenish brown glaze on interior and around rim.
Some sort of gray kaol or piso.
